intro: Pentacalia urbani, commonly known as the urban pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
